items.title: Attention to proper hand and overall body position
items.content: Which are crucial for playing comfortably and with the right technique.

items.title: Technical exercises of all kinds
items.content: They aim to develop finger strength, agility, coordination, and hand independence.

items.title: Classical repertoire
items.content: Pieces are chosen to target specific technical and musical goals such as phrasing, dynamics, rhythm and articulations.

items.title: Songs of student’s choice and teacher recommendations
items.content: Whether it’s film music, pop, jazz or contemporary songs, we encourage students to choose music they love to keep the lessons inspiring and motivating. The teacher finds an adapted version of the chosen music for the student’s level.

items.title: Music theory and sight reading
items.content: Learning to read notations, understanding rhythm, key signatures, musical patterns, terminologies, etc.

items.title: Detailed notes for homework and exercises
items.content: To do at home between lessons, ensuring consistent progress and reinforcement of concepts learned during the lesson.

items.title: Opportunity to participate in 3 concerts per year
items.content: To encourage self-confidence and gain performance skills.
